description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3ks9n","text":"This protocol details the molecular analyses of assembly of a serine integrase-based platform for functional validation of genetic switch controllers in eukaryotic cells","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

parent_collections.title: Protocols for assembly of a serine integrase-based platform for functional validation of genetic switch controllers in eukaryotic cells

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"67tru","text":"Select approximately 20 nucleotides both upstream and downstream of the core region of each att site formed in the reporter plasmid after recombination takes place.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8t3hl","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9qd3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"11t8v","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP forward primer must anneal to attL, while the reverse primer will anneal to the attR sequence.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"9CB408A9F21C4AE4AE74D40168D641AA"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"66fc2","text":"Use an online oligo design tool to define the best forward primers annealing to promoter sequence and reverse primers annealing to terminator sequence present in the reporter plasmid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3chvl","text":"To each respective tube, add  of template DNA and adjust the final volume to 25 µl if the DNA is too concentrated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2j1q5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f37k5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":8}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"640et","text":"Negative controls were prepared first by adding an equivalent volume of nuclease-free water and closing lids before pipetting templates to minimize contamination risk.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"495EACE167CB4FB28C363CA7813ECA6E"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fborf","text":"Resolve amplicons by electrophoresis in agarose gel following PCR. Run settings and gel density will depend on amplicon size according to the analyzed gene length and oligo pairs used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sk78","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b3lep","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"el4rj","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Load the same negative control in the every gel both technical (PCR without DNA) and biological (PCR using DNA from groups transformed with only either reporter plasmid or integrase plasmid) to ensure obtained bands indicate DNA inversion by Integrase activity. ? TROUBLESHOOTING","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"5547F896E0044FCFABA0FD51CFB299E6"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blvbe","text":"Excise the amplicon bands by cutting a square around them with the help of a scalpel on a UV light or blue light transilluminator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mu0e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2m15m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c6tmp","text":"▲CRITICAL STEP Use different scalpel blades for each band to avoid cross-contamination of samples.  ! CAUTION UV light can damage DNA, nicking and possibly removing DNA strand ends and interfering with downstream cloning steps. When available, blue light is highly recommended. If using UV, proceed quickly, turning the transilluminator off after making the cuts in the gel.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{},"guid":"2CD1C49A0D5F486EAA92D6437C89F8B8"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae2cd","text":"Proceed with amplicon purification using commercial DNA Clean-Up and Concentration kits, following the manufacturer’s recommendations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40u22","text":"Clone purified amplicons in an entry vector to ensure high-quality sequencing results. Although specifics may vary depending on the plasmid, we recommend a molar ratio of 1:3 (vector to amplicon) and 1.5 U of T4 ligase in 5 µl reactions with   incubation at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":242,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":258,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6hk4v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"16","unit":10}}}}
